design_intent.player_goal: Master Identity & Access Management (IAM): identity claims, AAA, SSO/federation, auth methods (passwords/MFA/biometrics), PAM, access-control models, and filesystem permissions for SY0-701.

mastery_model.update: Mastery += 8 on first correct; +4 on repeat correct; -6 on wrong (floor 0).

trap_list.name: Identification vs Authentication
trap_list.misconception: A username (or ID) claims who you are; authentication proves it (password, token, biometric, certificate).
trap_list.fix: Clarify this distinction before answering: A username (or ID) claims who you are; authentication proves it (password, token, biometric, certificate).

trap_list.name: Authentication vs Authorization vs Accounting (AAA)
trap_list.misconception: Authenticate = prove identity; Authorize = what you’re allowed to do; Accounting = track usage/actions (logs, time, bandwidth).
trap_list.fix: Clarify this distinction before answering: Authenticate = prove identity; Authorize = what you’re allowed to do; Accounting = track usage/actions (logs, time, bandwidth).

trap_list.name: SSO vs Federation
trap_list.misconception: SSO reduces repeated logins inside a boundary; federation extends trust across orgs/services using an IdP and standards (SAML/OIDC).
trap_list.fix: Clarify this distinction before answering: SSO reduces repeated logins inside a boundary; federation extends trust across orgs/services using an IdP and standards (SAML/OIDC).

trap_list.name: SAML vs OAuth vs OpenID Connect
trap_list.misconception: SAML/OIDC are used for federated authentication assertions; OAuth is authorization (delegated access without sharing credentials).
trap_list.fix: Clarify this distinction before answering: SAML/OIDC are used for federated authentication assertions; OAuth is authorization (delegated access without sharing credentials).

trap_list.name: RADIUS vs TACACS+
trap_list.misconception: RADIUS is common for network access (often UDP; password obfuscated); TACACS+ uses TCP and encrypts the whole packet + supports command-level control.
trap_list.fix: Clarify this distinction before answering: RADIUS is common for network access (often UDP; password obfuscated); TACACS+ uses TCP and encrypts the whole packet + supports command-level control.

trap_list.name: TOTP vs HOTP
trap_list.misconception: TOTP changes with time; HOTP changes with a counter. Both are OTPs; both can be phished/relayed if the user is tricked.
trap_list.fix: Clarify this distinction before answering: TOTP changes with time; HOTP changes with a counter. Both are OTPs; both can be phished/relayed if the user is tricked.

trap_list.name: Biometric errors: FAR vs FRR
trap_list.misconception: FAR = impostor accepted; FRR = legit user rejected. Tuning one typically impacts the other (trade-off).
trap_list.fix: Clarify this distinction before answering: FAR = impostor accepted; FRR = legit user rejected. Tuning one typically impacts the other (trade-off).

trap_list.name: RBAC vs ABAC
trap_list.misconception: RBAC grants based on roles; ABAC grants based on attributes (user/device/location/risk), enabling more fine-grained decisions.
trap_list.fix: Clarify this distinction before answering: RBAC grants based on roles; ABAC grants based on attributes (user/device/location/risk), enabling more fine-grained decisions.

trap_list.name: PAM vs ‘just give admin’
trap_list.misconception: PAM tries to avoid permanent admins: vaulting, JIT permissions, ephemeral creds, session recording, approvals.
trap_list.fix: Clarify this distinction before answering: PAM tries to avoid permanent admins: vaulting, JIT permissions, ephemeral creds, session recording, approvals.

trap_list.name: Linux file permissions numbers
trap_list.misconception: r=4, w=2, x=1 per user/group/other; 755 means rwx for owner, r-x for group and others.
trap_list.fix: Clarify this distinction before answering: r=4, w=2, x=1 per user/group/other; 755 means rwx for owner, r-x for group and others.

missions.name: Identity, AAA, and Trust Boundaries
missions.goal: Understand identity claims, AAA, and core enterprise auth protocols (RADIUS/TACACS+/Kerberos).

coaching_tips: Usernames identify; factors authenticate. Don't confuse the two in questions.
AAA is a pipeline: authenticate first, then authorize, then account/log.
RADIUS vs TACACS+ is a classic trap: payload encryption and admin command control.

missions.name: SSO & Federation: One Login, Many Doors
missions.goal: Differentiate SSO vs federation and correctly choose SAML/OIDC/OAuth based on authentication vs authorization needs.

coaching_tips: SSO reduces repeated logins; federation extends trust across organizations/services.
SAML/OIDC = authentication assertions; OAuth = authorization/delegated access.
Attestation = IdP formally verifying identity to the relying party.

missions.name: Authentication Hardening: Passwords, MFA, Biometrics
missions.goal: Apply modern password guidance, MFA factor logic, OTP realities, and biometric error trade-offs.

coaching_tips: Long passphrases + MFA beat complexity gymnastics most of the time.
OTP reduces replay but can still be phished/relayed; resist magical thinking.
Biometrics are probabilistic: FAR/FRR trade-off matters for security vs usability.

boss.name: Boss Fight: IAM Architect Under Fire
boss.premise: Mixed scenarios: pick the right auth method, stop privilege sprawl, and choose the correct access-control model/permissions.

constraint_cards.effect: At least one question emphasizes usability trade-offs (FAR/FRR, password rules, SSO).

constraint_cards.effect: Include at least one AAA/accounting/access review question this run.
